poem:
**Ambassadorial Aspirations**

From soldier's stride to diplomat's guise,  
Waltz waltzes where whispers collide.  
Through chambered voices and paper sighs,  
A badge, a post, a lofty prize.  
Yet, under flags, can purpose dim?  
In mirrored halls, fate dances grim.  
Will weight of power crush or lift,  
The fragile gift of global riff?
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Will Mike Waltz lead a ‘full-frontal assault’ on the UN? When and if Donald Trump’s nominee for ambassador to the UN, Mike Waltz, takes up the post, many are concerned that in his pursuit of the rehabilitation of his image, global development will not be a priority. Diplomats work for decades to be considered for the coveted position of ambassador, but in this case the role is a consolation prize for the 51-year-old former army". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
